skill.name: star-story-extraction
skill.description: Auto-invoke after task completion to extract interview-ready STAR stories from completed work.
skill.summary: Auto-invoke after task completion to extract interview-ready STAR stories from completed work.
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: This skill consists of a single markdown documentation file with no executable code, no network access, no file system operations, and no external command execution. It is purely a prompt-based skill that guides users through creating interview-ready STAR stories. All static findings are false positives: markdown code block delimiters were misidentified as shell execution, documentation references to security concepts were misidentified as cryptographic algorithms, and metadata fields were misidentified as network/filesystem access.

content.value_statement: Developers struggle to recall their accomplishments during interviews. This skill transforms completed work into structured STAR stories that demonstrate problem-solving ability. It guides users through Situation, Task, Action, and Result framework to capture interview-ready narratives.
actual_capabilities: Identifies story type based on problem solved including technical challenges, performance, security, and refactoring
Guides user through Situation, Task, Action, and Result framework with specific prompting questions
Provides quality checklist to ensure story completeness and interview readiness
Offers markdown template for consistent story format and local documentation
Suggests interview variations each story can address for different question types
Captures stories in markdown files organized by date and feature name in local directory
limitations: Does not auto-generate stories from git logs or code history
Requires user to actively recall and describe their work and accomplishments
Does not integrate with external job platforms or application tracking systems

use_cases.title: Prepare for behavioral interviews
use_cases.description: Transform recent project work into structured stories that demonstrate problem-solving skills during job interviews.

use_cases.title: Translate past experience
use_cases.description: Reframe previous work accomplishments into technical STAR stories that highlight transferable skills.

use_cases.title: Document team achievements
use_cases.description: Capture individual contributions and project outcomes to support performance reviews and promotion cases.

prompt_templates.title: Basic project story
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a STAR story for the feature I just completed. Guide me through Situation, Task, Action, and Result.

prompt_templates.title: Challenge-focused story
prompt_templates.prompt: I solved a challenging bug. Walk me through creating a STAR story that shows my debugging approach.

prompt_templates.title: Technical depth story
prompt_templates.prompt: I improved system performance. Help me structure a STAR story that highlights the technical decisions I made.

prompt_templates.title: Leadership story
prompt_templates.prompt: I mentored a junior developer. Create a STAR story that demonstrates my leadership and technical guidance.

output_examples.input: Help me create a STAR story for the authentication system I built last month.
output: Situation: Our application was experiencing a 40% drop-off during signup due to poor UX and no real-time validation.
Task: I was responsible for rebuilding the entire authentication flow, focusing on reducing friction while maintaining security.
Action: I implemented a multi-step form with real-time validation using React Hook Form and added JWT authentication with secure refresh token rotation.
Result: Sign-up completion improved by 35%, with zero authentication-related security incidents since launch.

output_examples.input: I fixed a critical performance issue in our database queries last week.
output: Situation: Our API response times exceeded 5 seconds during peak traffic, causing user complaints and increased bounce rates.
Task: I was tasked with identifying and optimizing the slowest database queries affecting the dashboard endpoint.
Action: I analyzed query execution plans, added composite indexes, and implemented query caching for frequently accessed data.
Result: API response times reduced from 5+ seconds to under 200ms, improving user engagement by 25%.

output_examples.input: I mentored a junior developer through their first API implementation.
output: Situation: A new hire was struggling to understand REST principles and was assigned their first API endpoint task.
Task: I was assigned to mentor them through the implementation while maintaining project timeline.
Action: I pair-programmed the first endpoint, explaining design decisions. I then reviewed their implementation with constructive feedback.
Result: They successfully completed the endpoint ahead of schedule and now mentor other new team members.

best_practices: Use specific technologies and technical details to demonstrate expertise rather than vague descriptions.
Quantify results with metrics whenever possible such as percentages, numbers, or time savings.
Focus on your individual contributions while acknowledging team context appropriately.
anti_patterns: Using "we" instead of "I" which dilutes your personal contribution and makes ownership unclear.
Making stories too long that exceed 2-3 minutes when spoken and lose interviewer attention.
Forgetting to include the result or impact of your work which leaves the story incomplete.

faq.question: What is the STAR method?
faq.answer: STAR stands for Situation, Task, Action, Result. It is a structured framework for answering behavioral interview questions by describing context, your role, what you did, and the outcome.

faq.question: How many STAR stories do I need?
faq.answer: Prepare 5-8 diverse stories covering different skills and challenges to ensure relevant examples for various interview questions.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with Claude Code after completing tasks?
faq.answer: Yes. Invoke this skill after completing any significant task to immediately capture the story while details are fresh in your mind.

faq.question: Is my data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: Stories are saved locally to your mentorspec directory. No data is sent to external services. Your career stories remain private.

faq.question: How is this different from resume writing?
faq.answer: Resumes summarize what you did. STAR stories explain how you did it with the narrative depth that resumes cannot include.

faq.question: What story types should I prepare?
faq.answer: Include stories for technical challenges, performance optimizations, security fixes, learning curve moments, and collaboration or leadership situations.
